message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.NA

The paper deals with learning shift-invariant components from training data and calculating the shift between two signals, which are problems related to machine learning and signal processing. The use of circulant and convolutional matrices also suggests a connection to linear algebra and numerical analysis. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.IT (Information Theory). The use of circulant matrices also suggests a possible connection to cs.SI (Signal Processing) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis).
